meanings.sent1: She professes her love for him every day.
meanings.sent2: He professes his innocence in the matter.
meanings.sent3: The magician professes to make things disappear with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent4: The artist professes to capture the essence of nature in her paintings.
meanings.sent5: The teacher professes the importance of kindness to her students.

meanings.definition: To claim or pretend to be
meanings.sent1: He professes to be a skilled pianist, but he can barely play a note.
meanings.sent2: The con artist professes to be a wealthy businessman to gain trust.
meanings.sent3: The cat professes to be the ruler of the house, demanding treats and attention.
meanings.sent4: The actor professes to be a superhero on screen, but in reality, he is just a regular guy.
meanings.sent5: The child professes to be a detective, solving mysteries in the backyard.

meanings.sent1: She professes her loyalty to her friends through thick and thin.
meanings.sent2: He professes his gratitude for the support he received during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The dog professes his excitement by wagging his tail vigorously.
meanings.sent4: The student professes his understanding of the complex math problem after hours of practice.
meanings.sent5: The leader professes his commitment to improving the community for all its residents.
